Generated Narrative: CodeSystem CIEL

Last updated: 2024-06-10 13:12:40+0000; Language: en

Properties

This code system defines the following properties for its concepts

NameCodeURITypeDescription
conceptclassconceptclasshttps://api.staging.openconceptlab.org/orgs/OCL/sources/Classes/conceptsstringStandard list of concept classes.
datatypedatatypehttps://api.staging.openconceptlab.org/orgs/OCL/sources/Datatypes/conceptsstringStandard list of concept datatypes.
inactiveinactivehttp://hl7.org/fhir/concept-propertiesCodingTrue if the concept is not considered active.

9860135 Transit patientA patient who is being seen outside of their regular care setting temporarily to receive medication refills, etc.
9860137 re-enroll
9860143 Treatment end date
9860145 Transferred outPatient transferred out to other services
9860147 Died
9860151 Treatment interrupted/stopped
9860153 ARV regimen/code for drugs collected
9860155 Antiretroviral treatment start dateWhen were the antiretroviral drugs started for the patient?
9860157 Toxicity, drugAdverse reaction to a drug (oral, parenteral, topical).
9860159 Regimen failureFailure of a therapy or treatment to achieve its end points.
9860161 Cannot afford treatmentPatient unable to pay for treatment.
9860163 Isoniazid / pyrazinamide / rifampinCombination drug also known as Rifater. Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.
9860165 Weight changeAlteration in a patient's weight. Could represent either a weight gain or loss.
9860167 UnknownGeneric answer to a question.
9860169 Ethambutol and isoniazidCombination drug used to treat tuberculosis, often used with other drugs. It's also known as Ethizide.
9860171 Rifampicin isoniazid pyrazinamide and ethambutolFixed-dose combination drug used to treat tuberculosis. Also known as Rifafour.
9860173 Reason antiretrovirals stoppedQuestion on encounter form. Part of the plan gathers a reason for stopping ARVs. This concept captures that information.
9860175 Tuberculosis treatment startedPart of the encounter form plan. Answers are drugs started at the end of the particular encounter.
9860177 Change formulationAnswer on encounter form. Implies that a patient's current drugs will be changed to meet a new formulation.
9860179 Completed total PMTCTAnswer to question. Implies that a person completed a course of total prevention of mother to child transmission therapy.
9860181 Rifampicin and isoniazidCombination drug also known as Rifinah. Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.
9860183 Currently pregnant
9860185 Medications unavailableDrugs/medications unavailable for use to treat patient. A reason for not receiving/taking medications.
9860187 Inpatient care or hospitalizationnone
9860189 OtherA generic, descriptive answer which is a handwritten, non-coded response to a question.
9860191 IsoniazidA crystalline antibacterial compound (C6H7N3O) used in the treatment of tuberculosis.
9860193 EthambutolAnti-mycobaterial drug used to treat active tuberculosis. Always used with other antimycobacterial agents.
9860195 Streptomycin
9860197 PyrazinamideAntituberculosis agent used to treat patients with active tuberculosis, usually in combination with other agents.
9860199 Refusal of treatment by patientPatient or client refusal of or resistance to medical, psychological, or psychiatric treatment. (APA, Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms, 8th ed.)
9860201 Planned treatment interruption
9860203 Non-compliance with treatment or therapyNot following the prescribed course of therapy or not taking prescribed medicines.
9860205 Treatment never started - patient refused
9860207 Other patient decision
9860209 Patient ageGeneric answer to a question. For example, a patient stops a medication because of his or her age.
9860211 Gender identity
9860213 Identifies as male gender
9860215 Identifies as female gender
9860217 Male to female transsexual
9860219 Female to male transsexual
9860221 Identifies as non-binary gender
9860223 Female gender
9860225 Restart medication
9860227 Currently breastfeeding childQuestion on encounter form: "Is the child currently being breastfed?"
9860229 New patient identifierLink to new patient identifier if patient has transferred out of facility
9860231 Reason for lost to follow upWhy the patient did not follow up with the health care?
9860233 Health facility
9860235 CommunityPeople with whom the client lives in the same geographical area or neighborhood
9860237 mobile voluntary counseling and testing program
9860239 Home based HIV testing program
9860241 HIV positiveIncludes the spectrum of human immunodeficiency virus infections that range from asymptomatic seropositivity, thru AIDS-related complex (ARC), to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).
9860243 NegativeResponse to a finding or test result.
9921831 HIV program end dateQuestion on encounter form. The date the patient was removed from the HIV program.
5240 Lost to followupPatients that are lost to followup.. boolean question.

A patient who is being seen outside of their regular care setting temporarily to receive medication refills, etc.

Combination drug also known as Rifater.  Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.

Generic answer to a question.
Combination drug used to treat tuberculosis, often used with other drugs.  It's also known as Ethizide.
Fixed-dose combination drug used to treat tuberculosis.  Also known as Rifafour.
Question on encounter form.  Part of the plan gathers a reason for stopping ARVs.  This concept captures that information.
Part of the encounter form plan. Answers are drugs started at the end of the particular encounter.
Answer on encounter form.  Implies that a patient's current drugs will be changed to meet a new formulation.
Answer to question.  Implies that a person completed a course of total prevention of mother to child transmission therapy.
Combination drug also known as Rifinah. Used in the early treatment of tuberculosis.
Drugs/medications unavailable for use to treat patient. A reason for not receiving/taking medications.
